email.title: Google Inside Look Program and Jane Street Internship
email.text:
Hi everyone,
First of all, congratulations to all of us on finishing exams! Certainly a big feat that we should all be proud of!
We have a few messages for opportunities that you might be interested in and you can can a look below for more details.
We hope that everyone is safe during this period and we will continue updating you with messages and notices from our sponsors and more!
email.heading: Inside Look Program Applications are Now Open
email.text:
**Calling all students!**
We hope you’re staying safe during this unsettling time. We know many of you might be working or studying in different situations to what you’re used to, or adapting to a new way of living. We wanted to reach out and say we’re right with you.
The [Inside Look program](https://buildyourfuture.withgoogle.com/programs/inside-look/) was created to bring together a like minded group of students from all over Europe, the Middle East and Africa, to connect over their passion for technology and a desire to learn more about life in a tech role at Google. This year, the program will be going fully digital for the first time. We believe that we can deliver a really special experience for students over our digital platforms, and we’d love to see an application from you.
**What is Inside Look and when does it take place?**
We're excited to invite students graduating later than August 2021, studying computer science or a related subject to apply for Inside Look. This year, we’re pleased to announce that we’ll be hosting Inside Look Goes Digital on 27th & 28th August. Selected attendees will be invited to join an immersive two-day virtual program, including tech talks, panels, technical interview practice, fun social activities, and — in true Google fashion — the chance to get your hands on some Google freebies, delivered directly to you at home!
While we are unable to host every applicant at Inside Look Goes Digital, we’ll also be holding Inside Look: YouTube Live on 21st September, where all applicants will be invited to hear from Google engineers on how they build products at scale, plus top tips from our hiring team.
The Inside Look program is committed to supporting diversity at Google and the tech industry as a whole. Students who are members of any group that has been historically underrepresented in the tech industry are encouraged to apply!
**Sounds great! How do I apply?**
[Click here to apply now](https://services.google.com/fb/forms/insidelook2020/), including an up-to-date CV. **Applications are open until 23:59 BST on 1st June**
**Wait, what if I don’t have an updated CV?**\ No problem! We want to give you the best possible chance of success when applying for this competitive program, so we’ve recorded - from our homes - a [video guide](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dA3NX-Tpe4E&feature=youtu.be) to writing a great CV. We know it’s hard to convey all the things you’re proud of in a concise way, so we’re here to help!

If you have questions please visit [our website](https://buildyourfuture.withgoogle.com/programs/inside-look/) or email [inside-look-2020@google.com](mailto:inside-look-2020@google.com).
Many thanks,
Google University Programs Team
email.heading: Jane Street Autumn Internship
email.text:
**Jane Street invites you to apply to our autumn software engineering internship!**
**About the Position**\ We are big believers in functional programming, using OCaml, a statically-typed functional programming language, as our primary development language. We also believe in the value of open source software, using it in our daily work and releasing hundreds of thousands of lines of our own code as open source.
**About You** - Top-notch programming skills. - Deep experience with—and love for—technology. There’s no specific checklist; we use code to approach a variety of problems, so we’re interested in everything from machine learning to systems administration to programming language design. - Strong interpersonal skills. Software development at Jane Street is highly collaborative, and we are looking for people who can work effectively in small, close-knit teams.
We don’t expect you to have experience with functional programming, OCaml, or finance; we’re happy to hire talented engineers and teach them what they need to know.
If you'd like to get an idea of what we cover in our software engineering interview process, you can read this [blog post](https://blog.janestreet.com/what-a-jane-street-dev-interview-is-like/), and to get an idea of projects software engineering interns work on you can read [this post](https://blog.janestreet.com/what-the-interns-have-wrought-2019/) highlighting a few of our Summer 2019 projects.
We hope to host this internship in our new London office. However, both our employees' and interns' safety and well-being are our main priority, and we may move this to a remote internship nearer the time. This internship is intended for those based in Europe and the UK.
**[APPLY HERE](https://www.janestreet.com/join-jane-street/apply/4720341002/)**
[Keep up with Jane Street recruiting events by following our Facebook page.](https://www.facebook.com/JaneStreetRecruit)
